answers.answer: I am not sure it is a similar problem with me. First I did have a tingling sensation on my right foot then started to get pain on ball of my foot which was diognosed Neuroma.I had an injection once but pain is not gone completly so waiting for scan.
This is usually solved by not wearing the shoes that are too tight.  Elevate your foot, use antiinflammatories like ibuprofen.

It could be referred pain from your lower back.  If the problem is coming from the back, the referred pain will continue until the problem in the back is resolved.If you have diabetes, pains in the feet is a common problem due to damaged nerves.  If this is the case, sugar levels need to be maintained at a good level.You may find that wearing orthotic shoe insoles may help to support your feet, hence reducing the problem.  A physiotherapist would be able to give you advice on the correct type of orthotic insoles to wear for the problem that you have.Take care if you do go for anti-inflammatories as these do not suit everyone and they also need to be taken with or after food as they can cause damage to the stomach.You really need to find out where the problem is actually coming from to be able to lessen or alleviate the symptoms.Best wishes.
Hi mailee what kind of injection you have taken?
Hi Caryopteris I did not go out often and even when I went out, I wore slippers which is similar as the beachwear slippers.

question: I have a pinched nerve 3months back and I went to have it xray and the doctor says it seems alright and then I went to chinese traditional doctor they did acupunture and I feel the pain is gone for awhile and the pain is back again for another 2-3days and it totally recovered.Now, the pinched nerve pain in my left feet is back again and I am so afraid that I might not able to walk again. This time the pain is worst when I walked. Is like electric shock to my nerve. Can anybody tell me what is it or can you please advise me if you have ever came across such problem? Will it become a permanent problem?
title: pinch nerve in my feet
